problem.markdown:
>>In Excel 2016, which two options below will you find the Manage Data Model icon in order to access the Excel data model? (Hint: for those of you who don’t have Excel 2016, Dany clearly demonstrates both options within the first couple of minutes of the video).<<
[ ] Select Data tab, then Get External Data group. [ ] Select Power Pivot tab, then Settings. [x] Select Data tab, then Data Tools group. [x] Select Power Pivot tab, then Data Model group.
[explanation] The third and fourth options represent the correct answer. [explanation]
problem.p: In Excel 2016, which two options below will you find the Manage Data Model icon in order to access the Excel data model? (Hint: for those of you who don’t have Excel 2016, Dany clearly demonstrates both options within the first couple of minutes of the video).

checkboxgroup.label: In Excel 2016, which two options below will you find the Manage Data Model icon in order to access the Excel data model? (Hint: for those of you who don’t have Excel 2016, Dany clearly demonstrates both options within the first couple of minutes of the video).
checkboxgroup.choice: Select Data tab, then Get External Data group.
Select Power Pivot tab, then Settings.
Select Data tab, then Data Tools group.
Select Power Pivot tab, then Data Model group.

div.p: The third and fourth options represent the correct answer.
